questions.text: A pharmaceutical company showed the following in an article: "1500 subjects with a cold were treated with our new medicine. Within three days, 95% were asymptomatic and this result was statistically significant." The company claims the new medicine was effective. Is this conclusion justified?

options.label: A
options.text: Yes, because the effect was very large (95% of the subjects benefitted from treatment)

options.label: B
options.text: No, because statistical significance indicates that the null hypothesis ("no effect") was correct

options.label: C
options.text: No, because no control group was involved in the study

options.label: D
options.text: Yes, because the effect of treatment could not be explained by chance

questions.correct_answer: C. No, because no control group was involved in the study

questions.text: The main advantage of a randomized controlled trial (RCT) compared to all other epidemiology study designs is that the RCT:

options.label: A
options.text: Equally distributes characteristics that may be independent risk factors for the outcome of interest over the study arms

options.label: B
options.text: Is prospective thereby eliminating the need for historical data

options.label: D
options.text: Guarantees that confounding bias will not occur

questions.correct_answer: A. Equally distributes characteristics that may be independent risk factors for the outcome of interest over the study arms

questions.text: An epidemiologist wants to assess the effect of tea drinking on blood pressure. He decides to do an intervention study. Which of the following measures does not increase the internal validity of the study?

options.label: A
options.text: Careful monitoring of blood pressure during the study

options.label: D
options.text: Random selection of participants from the general population

questions.correct_answer: D. Random selection of participants from the general population

questions.text: An epidemiologist performed a double-blind, randomized, placebo-controlled trial to examine the effect of fish oil supplementation on memory complaints. In the group that received fish oil, 19% of the participants forgot to take their daily supplements during the study whereas this was only 3% in the placebo group. Is this a problem?

options.label: A
options.text: Yes, because this affects the external validity of the study

options.label: B
options.text: Yes, because the study outcome can be biased

options.label: C
options.text: No, because participants and investigators were blinded towards the type of treatment in both groups

options.label: D
options.text: No, because all confounders were equally distributed over both groups due to randomization

questions.correct_answer: B. Yes, because the study outcome can be biased
